instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPUâ€™s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message:
I'm trying to figure out whats wrong with this board there's no green light
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - Present
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - Present 
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - Present
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> - Missing
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> - Present
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - missing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message: SMC is not running. Was there corrosion around SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message: no corrosion around smc. how do i test it to be 100% sure that is the smc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message: To be 100% sure you replace it with a 100% new one. None of that is possible so just replace it with one from a scrap board and pray that it works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message:
I replace the SMC and the fan is spinning I have a green light but there's no imagine and there's no chime. When I press the Shift+Control+Option I get a green light and then an orange one that means the SMC is resting. Is it something to do with CPU Vcore?
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 0.95V
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL> is 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message: USB mouse lights up when plugged in?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message: no light when I plug the mouse

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message: Where did your replacement SMC come from?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message: Aliexpress from a board. Do I need to replace the SMC again?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message: It could be anything at this point. All power is there so it could be a bad SMC. It could be the termination resistors in the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> data lines. Did the SMC come from an identical board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no green light
threads.message: Yes it come from identical board. I place another order I'm waiting for it. Thanks
